alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 5:07PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Wayne, southwestern Laurel, southwestern Bell, southwestern Knox, Pulaski, eastern McCreary and Whitley Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 506 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Magnum to near Zion Hill. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 35 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Zion Hill and Ayers around 510 PM EDT. Pointer around 515 PM EDT. Lot, Red Ash, Saxton, Mountain Ash, Stab and Pleasant View around 520 PM EDT. Packard and Hogue around 525 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Wilkerson, Polly Camp, Gatliff, Nevisdale, Dixie, Science Hill, Pearl, Siler, Carpenter, Frakes, Fonde, Pruden, Goins, Bobtown, Birdseye, Chenoa, Bandy and Woodstock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne; Whitley
